p: Here, we examine the allelopathic effects of the invasive shrub R. typhina on the cultivated plant T. erecta via changes in soil conditions and microbial communities. We compare soil properties, metabolic activity and microbial carbon utilization at increasing concentration of R. typhina root extracts and examine the effects of changing soil conditions on T. erecta growth. We hypothesize that 1) R. typhina root extracts inhibit plant growth; 2) R. typhina root extracts decrease soil conditions; 3) The reasons of inhibition are the extracts negatively impact soil conditions and rhizophere soil microbial carbon source utilization.
